question: Ban on which armed separatist has been recently extended for 5 years by the Indian Government?
option3: Muslim United Liberation Tigers of Assam
explanation: The Indian Governement on November 24,2019 extended ban on Assam-based Bodo insurgent group National Democratic Front of Bodoland (NDFB) for its involvement in violent activities, including killings, extortion and for joining hands with anti-India forces. After the NDFB was declared an outlawed outfit in 1990s, the ban has been extended every five years since then.
